#Text=Slovak Karst National Park
#Text=Slovak Karst National Park ( Slovenský kras ) is in Eastern Slovakia .
#Text=Known for its caves , together with the Aggtelek cave systems they make up the UNESCO World Heritage Site " Caves of Aggtelek Karst and Slovak Karst " .

column1: #Text=Understand
#Text=The main attraction of the park are the caves , of which more than 700 have been discovered here and in Aggtelek on the Hungarian side of the border .
#Text=The park is made up of three parts .
#Text=Landscape
#Text=The plains ( plateaus ) have many karst formations , such as karst pits with diameters of up to 250 m and depths of about 45 m , conical hills , blind and half-blind valley and dales .
#Text=The subterranean karst is known for its deep vertical abysses , such as :
#Text=Čertova diera ( literally Devil 's Hole ; depth : 186 m )
#Text=Brázda ( 181 m )
#Text=Malá železná priepasť ( Little Iron Abyss ; 142 m )
#Text=Diviačia priepasť ( Boar Abyss ; 122 m )
#Text=Some of the abysses are collapsed , especially the Silická ľadnica ( Silica Ice Abyss ; 110 m )
#Text=Get in
#Text=Towns and villages can be accessed by bus or train from Košice and Rožňava .
#Text=Get around
#Text=While the hills are not too high ( 600-800m ) , the hiking can be demanding - especially in terms of orientation .
#Text=There are not too many of water sources or villages around , and the signage is not ideal .
#Text=Maps like OpenStreetMap , hiking . sk and mapy . cz seem to have good coverage of the area 's hiking trails .
#Text=Caves
#Text=Thanks to the nature of the park , there are many caves and other similar nature features present .
#Text=Open to visitors are the following caves :
#Text=Domica ( Near Kečovo
#Text=) .
#Text=One of the most beautiful caves of its kind , it 's the most popular one .
#Text=Ride in a boat in the cave is possible .
#Text=Bigger part of this 25-km long cave belongs into Aggtelek 's Baradla cave in Hungary .
#Text=The cave shows signs of setlements 4000 years ago .
#Text=Gombasecká ( Gombasec ) ( Near Slavec
#Text=) .
#Text=Closed November-March
#Text=Jasovská ( Jasov ) ( Near Jasov
#Text=) .
#Text=Closed November-March
#Text=Smaller caves :
#Text=Krásnohorská jaskyňa .
#Text=Ochtinská aragonitová jaskyňa ( Easy access by road from Hrádok village .
#Text=Much more demanding hike up from Ochtiná village is possible too . ) .
#Text=A small , approx. 45 minutes long , but unique cave .
#Text=" Decorated " with aragonite formations - only 3 such caves were discovered so far in the world .
#Text=Closed November-March .
#Text=Silická ľadnica ( Stop 2 km from Silica village at a small parking spot , then go 15 min by foot ) .
#Text=Frozen all year long , this freely accessible cave is lowest altitude ice cave in Europe .
#Text=Going outside the designated path is prohibited .
#Text=The cave lies up a small flat hill in a picturesque nature that is worth seeing on itself .
#Text=Castles
#Text=Krásna Hôrka .
#Text=One of the most recognizable buildings in the area .
#Text=The castle was fire-damaged in 2012 , and thus closed for public ( est. until 2018 ) .
#Text=Turniansky hrad ( Above the " Turňa nad Bodvou " village . ) .
#Text=Castle ruins on one of the hills of the mountain range .
#Text=Betliar .
#Text=An exhibition about the life and culture of the Hungarian nobility in the 18th and 19th century .
#Text=Nice park and small waterfall .
#Text=Other attractions
#Text=Hájske vodopády ( Jasov ) ( Between villages Hačava and Háj ( nearer to the latter ) ) .
#Text=Series of about 10 small waterfalls .
#Text=Can be combined with visit to a small , partly gypsy , village - Hačava .
#Text=Do
#Text=Zádielska dolina ( Zádiel valley ) ( Start at parking in village " Zádiel " ) .
#Text=3-km long karst canyon , only 10m wide and 300m high in some places .
#Text=Slavošovský tunel ( Slavošovce tunnel ) .
#Text=An unfinished 2.5-km long train tunnel ( be sure to have a good headlamp ! ) , accessible by general public , connects Slavošovce and Magnezitovice .
#Text=The northern entrance is easily accessible , the southern has layers of stream sediments and thus you may get very dirty trying to cross it ( or even get stuck in 1-m deep mud at times ) .
#Text=Different happenings take place here at times .
#Text=Eat
#Text=Possibilities to eat around the park are mostly limited to restaurants around the main roads and in the villages/cities .
#Text=A somewhat underwhelming hut with basic food ( soup , beer and some snacks ) is about 3 km up the Zádielska valley , open on weekends during the tourist season .
#Text=Lodging
#Text=Farebný penzión .
#Text=A budget guesthouse , with a cozy pub downstairs and a terrace useful esp . during summer .
#Text=The place is by no means luxurious , but it 's clean , is equipped for families ( kitchen , 2 bathrooms , social room with games , internet ) and the owner is very helpful . €10/person .
#Text=Go next
#Text=Slovak Paradise National Park
#Text=Aggtelek
#Text=Rožňava
#Text=Betliar
#Text=Krásnohorské Podhradie
#Text=Jasov
#Text=Turňa nad Bodvou
